definition: a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
to fight/fight/war/battle
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Women love quickies as much as men do.
sentences.chinese: 女人和男人一樣喜歡速戰速決。

sentences.english: So the sword male plan to kill the villagers, to ensure a quick victory of the war.
sentences.chinese: 於是劍雄打算殺了那些村名，以保證戰爭速戰速決。

sentences.english: Being an aggressive baseliner, he is also known for finishing off his opponents quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位底線攻擊型球員，以速戰速決著稱。

definition: to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
voice-over/background narration
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
prolonged war/war of attrition
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to correct an error
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
